xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #medsavant on 23 June 2013
xwikidoc.content: <bvancea> has joined #medsavant 08:28 <bvancea> has left #medsavant 10:50 <bvancea> has joined #medsavant 11:07 <bvancea> hello sdumitriu 11:07 <bvancea> you by any chance on? 11:16 <sdumitriu> Hi 11:16 <sdumitriu> Not really 11:17 <bvancea> haha, well, its sunday 11:18 <bvancea> I've been planning to recuperate some of the coding I've lost this last week yesterday, but I've managed to catch a cold 11:19 <bvancea> so it was bed time for most of yesterday and now I'm trying to do something productive 11:19 <bvancea> :D 11:20 <bvancea> I'm considering using JMeter to test the index like we talked about during the hangout, but I've only done simple testing before using it 11:21 <bvancea> is it ok if I write some small client for that in Java instead? 11:21 <bvancea> btw, if you're not really on, just answer if/when you have the time 11:40 <bvancea_> has joined #medsavant 12:15 <sdumitriu> Back 12:15 <sdumitriu> WDYM a small client? 12:17 <bvancea> a class that I'll use to build queries, sent them to solr and check the response time 12:17 <bvancea> client may not be best name for it 12:21 <sdumitriu> Sure 12:21 <sdumitriu> Sounds good 12:23 <bvancea> cool 12:24 <bvancea> I've browsed the JMeter documentation to see how to create complex queries, where parameter values could be picked randomly 12:25 <bvancea> but it'll probably be easier for now to just stick with java 17:37 <bvancea> has joined #medsavant 17:38 <bvancea> TDD with maven is really amuzing 17:39 <bvancea> you write the tests, can't compile because maven install needs to be runned first to build the classes 17:39 <bvancea> mvn install fails because tests fails 17:39 <bvancea> ;))
